title: Bindi Irwin's chicken dies after speaking about 'growing her family' with fiance Chandler Powell
text:
The Irwin family faced heartbreak this week as their 13-year-old chicken Piggy sadly passed away.

As a family of wildlife warriors, the death of their longtime companion has clearly had a significant impact on them.

Bindi uploaded a heartfelt post on Thursday holding the pet in healthier times.

'My lovely girl': The Irwin family has faced yet another heart break in the family as their 13-year-old chicken Piggy sadly passed this week with Bindi writing a heartfelt message online

'For nearly 13 years you made us smile through life’s ups and downs. Rest In Peace my lovely girl,' she wrote.

Younger brother Robert spoke about his feathered friend, posting an image taken of him and the bird recently and when he was a toddler.

'Saying goodbye to one of our dearest friends. Almost 13 years ago, "Piggy" came into our family and brought so much joy to everyone who knew her over the years,' he wrote.

Younger brother Robert spoke about his friend, posting an image taken of him and the bird recently and when he was a toddler

'I’ve never known a chicken with the character and personality that this hen had, she was one of a kind. We’ll miss you little Pig.'

Terri also paid tribute to the bird she would have brought into their struggling family around the time her husband Steve tragically died.

'We loved her every day of her nearly 13 years,' she wrote.

Wildlife photographer Robert said they were blown away by how much character the bird had

It is the latest death in the Irwin family as they try to turn their lives towards the future as Bindi prepares for her upcoming wedding with Chandler Powell.

Only a few days ago the 21-year-old posted an image of their families together around a turtle and wrote how grateful she was for their future.

'Our family is growing and that is definitely something to smile about,' she said.

Terri also paid tribute to the bird she would have brought into their struggling family around the time her husband Steve tragically died

Speaking to People, the 21-year-old said: 'I really want to include Dad on the day and make sure that he is with us in some way.'

After becoming engaged on the grounds of Queensland's Australia Zoo on her 21st birthday in July, she has been busy planning her big day.

Bindi explained to the publication: 'We'll be able to all get up as a little family and light a candle in his honour and share a few words on what an amazing dad he was and still is.'

A future of smiles ahead: Bindi Irwin has revealed she will honour her late father Steve with a candle lighting ceremony on her wedding day (pictured Bindi and her fiance Chandler Powell)

She was eight-years-old when her late father Steve died after a stingray barb pierced his chest during a 2006 trip for a documentary he was filming.

Bindi announced she was engaged to boyfriend Chandler back in July after he proposed to her on her 21st birthday.

She met Chandler, a former professional wake boarder, in 2013 while giving him a tour of Australia Zoo.

The Florida-born athlete now works with Bindi, her mother Terri, and brother Robert at Australia Zoo.
